intro: Zygophyllidium delicatulum, commonly known as the delicate zygophyll, is a small flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae, which includes plants adapted to dry environments. The plant features delicate, often hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
